Secretary Job at Avocado Virtual Solutions




        
    

        
        Avocado Virtual Solutions (AVS) is a professional recruitment agency and business support service dedicated to helping entrepreneurs, small businesses, and busy professionals streamline their operations. We specialize in administrative support, customer service, social media management, recruitment assistance with onboarding, and business/company branding. Our mission is to help clients save time, enhance productivity, and build strong, recognizable brands while they focus on growing their businesses.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Secretary

Job Location: Utako, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

About Role
     

            
    




	We are seeking a responsible and well-organized Secretary to provide administrative and clerical support, ensuring smooth day-to-day office operations.
	The ideal candidate will handle correspondence, documentation, and scheduling efficiently.


Key Responsibilities


	Answer phone calls and attend to inquiries professionally
	Manage office correspondence, emails, and documents
	Schedule appointments and maintain calendars
	Prepare letters, reports, and basic office documents
	Maintain proper filing and record-keeping systems
	Support daily administrative and office operations
	Ensure confidentiality of office information.


Requirements & Qualifications


	OND / HND / BSc in Secretarial Studies, Business Administration, or related field
	1 - 2 years of experience in a similar role (added advantage)
	Good written and verbal communication skills
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel)
	Strong organizational and multitasking skills
	Professional appearance and good work ethic.


Personal Attributes:


	Polite, courteous, and reliable
	Detail-oriented and well-organized
	Ability to work with minimal supervision.


Salary
N70,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their applications and CV to: avsabujacareer@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

	Schedule meeting for staff and prospective clients

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "B2B Sales Associate",
  "description": "Hempawa Consult Limited - Our client, a Leading FinTech Company, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: B2B Sales Associate

Job Locations:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT) and Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time&nbsp;(In-person role)

Description


	We are hiring a B2B Sales Associate for a leading FinTech company redefining digital financial inclusion across Nigeria.
	This is a full-time, in-person role based in Abuja and Lagos, designed for a commercially driven professional who excels at prospecting, relationship management, and closing institutional partnerships.


The Opportunity
As a B2B Sales Associate, you will:


	Drive B2B Sales Execution: Identify, prospect, and engage schools, educational institutions, and corporate partners.
	Support Revenue Growth: Convert qualified leads into active partners and contribute directly to monthly revenue targets.
	Manage Sales Pipeline: Track leads, meetings, proposals, and closures across assigned territories.
	Execute Field &amp; Virtual Sales: Conduct physical visits, presentations, demos, and follow-up meetings with prospective partners.
	Support Partner Onboarding: Work with internal teams to ensure smooth onboarding and activation of new B2B clients.
	Strengthen Relationships: Build and maintain long-term relationships with institutional partners to encourage repeat usage and referrals.
	Collaborate Internally: Work closely with growth, operations, and product teams to align sales activities with business objectives.


Who We&rsquo;re Looking For


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree
	Sales-Oriented Professional: 1 - 3 years of experience in B2B sales, business development, or account management (fintech, edtech, or services industry is an advantage).
	Strong Communicator: Confident in pitching, negotiating, and presenting solutions to decision-makers.
	Target-Driven: Comfortable working with clear revenue and performance targets.
	Highly Organised: Able to manage multiple leads, meetings, and follow-ups efficiently.
	Market-Aware: Understanding of institutional sales dynamics within Nigeria.
	Based in Abuja or Lagos: Must reside in or be willing to work full-time on-site.


Why This Role Stands Out:


	Revenue Exposure: Play a direct role in driving institutional revenue growth.
	Career Growth: Opportunity to grow into senior sales or partnership roles.
	High-Impact Market: Sell solutions that improve access to education and financial inclusion.
	Performance Recognition: Strong emphasis on results and measurable impact.
	Field &amp; Office Balance: Combination of relationship-driven fieldwork and structured sales execution.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV &amp; Cover Letter to:&nbsp;career@hempawaconsult.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

        Hempawa Consult Limited - Our client, a Leading FinTech Company, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: B2B Sales Associate

Job Locations: Abuja (FCT) and Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (In-person role)

Description
     

            
    




	We are hiring a B2B Sales Associate for a leading FinTech company redefining digital financial inclusion across Nigeria.
	This is a full-time, in-person role based in Abuja and Lagos, designed for a commercially driven professional who excels at prospecting, relationship management, and closing institutional partnerships.


The Opportunity
As a B2B Sales Associate, you will:


	Drive B2B Sales Execution: Identify, prospect, and engage schools, educational institutions, and corporate partners.
	Support Revenue Growth: Convert qualified leads into active partners and contribute directly to monthly revenue targets.
	Manage Sales Pipeline: Track leads, meetings, proposals, and closures across assigned territories.
	Execute Field & Virtual Sales: Conduct physical visits, presentations, demos, and follow-up meetings with prospective partners.
	Support Partner Onboarding: Work with internal teams to ensure smooth onboarding and activation of new B2B clients.
	Strengthen Relationships: Build and maintain long-term relationships with institutional partners to encourage repeat usage and referrals.
	Collaborate Internally: Work closely with growth, operations, and product teams to align sales activities with business objectives.


Who We’re Looking For


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree
	Sales-Oriented Professional: 1 - 3 years of experience in B2B sales, business development, or account management (fintech, edtech, or services industry is an advantage).
	Strong Communicator: Confident in pitching, negotiating, and presenting solutions to decision-makers.
	Target-Driven: Comfortable working with clear revenue and performance targets.
	Highly Organised: Able to manage multiple leads, meetings, and follow-ups efficiently.
	Market-Aware: Understanding of institutional sales dynamics within Nigeria.
	Based in Abuja or Lagos: Must reside in or be willing to work full-time on-site.


Why This Role Stands Out:


	Revenue Exposure: Play a direct role in driving institutional revenue growth.
	Career Growth: Opportunity to grow into senior sales or partnership roles.
	High-Impact Market: Sell solutions that improve access to education and financial inclusion.
	Performance Recognition: Strong emphasis on results and measurable impact.
	Field & Office Balance: Combination of relationship-driven fieldwork and structured sales execution.


Method of Application

	Generating Sales Inquiries and responding to Request For Quotes and inquiries from Clients.
	Meeting regular sales targets and coordinating sales projects;
	Supporting marketing activities by attending trade shows, conferences and other marketing events;
	Starting-up, maintaining, calibrating, testing and troubleshooting a wide variety of Instruments, process monitoring & Controlling Instruments, industrial instruments.
	Liaising with clients, suppliers, Principals and relevant authorities
	Liaising with other members of the sales team and other technical experts;
	Promoting Company’s product portfolio and lines of representation amongst current and prospective clients by Emails, Cold Calls and Scheduled Visits.
	Preparing action plans and schedules to identify specific targets and to project the number of contacts to be made.
	Identifying sales prospects and following up on new leads and referrals resulting from field activity.
	Preparing presentations, proposals, quotes, Purchase Orders, Invoices and sales contracts.
	Following up on submitted quotations, specification queries, submitted invoices.
	Developing and maintaining sales and marketing materials.
	Providing content management for the company's websites and e-commerce sites.
	Develop and implement special sales activities to reduce stock.
	Preparing a variety of status reports, including activity, closing, follow-up, and adherence to goals.
	Assisting with all aspects of administrative management, directory maintenance, logistics, equipment inventory and storage.
	Performing multifaceted general office support.
	Other duties as assigned.


Qualifications


	Graduate (minimum) qualification in Electrical & Electronics Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Instrumentation Engineering, Mechatronics
	Preferably Male Candidates


Skills and Experience:


	Minimum of 2 Years of Prior Work Experience in Similar Job
	Supervision Ability of Junior Staff
	Able to quickly assimilate new technical knowledge and interested in building a career with a growth-oriented Company.
	Solid organizational and planning skills.
	Good command of English.
	Commercial acumen and the ability to promote a technical solution as a value for money exercise
	Computer literacy, especially with regard to modern scientific user interfaces, document and presentation preparation and report writing
	An understanding of business management systems, including Excel, Word, PowerPoint and knowledge of a CRM tool is an asset
	Excellent communication skills in English, written and spoken.
	Extensive travel within and outside Lagos are an essential part of the job.


Other Requirements:


	Tenacity and self-motivation inspired by success, enthusiasm, drive and initiative directed towards sales growth
	Ability to operate alone and to meet ambitious but achievable targets, particularly with regard to sales success
	Self-discipline and the ability to decide priorities in a rapidly changing commercial environment
	An outgoing and likeable personality with a high degree of personal integrity
	The personality of a natural team player, willing and able to build confidence and to establish co-operative relationships with personnel throughout the Company
	A very high standard of personal presentation.
	Self-starter attitude, customer oriented with strong client relationships building skills.
	High level of energy, motivation, enthusiasm, initiative, commitment and willingness to learn.
